statements: SELECT * FROM MassiveData
SELECT id, data FROM MassiveData
SELECT data, timestamp FROM MassiveData WHERE id = 1
SELECT * FROM MassiveData ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT id, data, timestamp FROM MassiveData WHERE timestamp > '2022-01-01'
SELECT * FROM MassiveData ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT data, id FROM MassiveData WHERE id > 10 ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
SELECT * FROM MassiveData WHERE data LIKE '%example%';
SELECT id, timestamp FROM MassiveData WHERE id BETWEEN 5 AND 10 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT id, data, timestamp FROM MassiveData ORDER BY data ASC, timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM departments WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT department_name, manager_id FROM departments WHERE department_id = 2;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, department_id FROM employees ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE department_id = 2 ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT first_name, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE first_name LIKE 'J%';
SELECT * FROM massive_data;
SELECT data_value, id FROM massive_data;
SELECT info_name, info_description FROM data_info;
SELECT data_id, mapping_type FROM data_mapping;
SELECT * FROM data_mapping;
SELECT id, data_value FROM massive_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM massive_data WHERE data_value LIKE '%example%';
SELECT info_name, info_description FROM data_info WHERE info_id > 100 ORDER BY info_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM data_mapping WHERE mapping_type = 'typeA' AND data_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM data_info INNER JOIN data_mapping ON data_info.info_id = data_mapping.data_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, email FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT post_content, created_at FROM posts ORDER BY created_at DESC;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS total_likes FROM likes GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT users.username, posts.post_content FROM users JOIN posts ON users.user_id = posts.user_id;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = 'john_doe';
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE registration_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT post_content FROM posts WHERE user_id = 1 ORDER BY created_at DESC;
SELECT u.username, p.post_content, c.comment_text FROM users u JOIN posts p ON u.user_id = p.user_id JOIN comments c ON p.post_id = c.post_id WHERE u.user_id = 2;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_likes, p.post_content FROM likes l JOIN posts p ON l.post_id = p.post_id GROUP BY p.post_id HAVING total_likes > 10 ORDER BY total_likes DESC;
SELECT * FROM table1;
SELECT name, age FROM table1 WHERE id = 1;
SELECT product_name, quantity FROM table3 ORDER BY quantity DESC;
SELECT user_id, city, address FROM table2 WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT department, employee_id, salary FROM table5 ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT id, name, age FROM table1 WHERE age > 25 ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT user_id, address, city FROM table2 WHERE city = 'New York' ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT order_id, product_name, quantity FROM table3 WHERE quantity > 10 ORDER BY quantity DESC, product_name ASC;
SELECT customer_id, email, phone_number FROM table4 WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com%' ORDER BY customer_id;
SELECT employee_id, department, salary FROM table5 WHERE salary BETWEEN 50000 AND 80000 ORDER BY salary DESC, department ASC;
